lexUnit.name: wedge.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a subpart of a circular whole

sentence.text: But the Kittyhawk had a long wedge of an engine that blocked the pilot 's forward view .
It will potentially drive a wedge between the Catholic H.E .
That 's how a wedge of flamed maple would be cut from a tree .

Both are sold in pre-packed wedges or from the cutting counter .

English wingers Bloomer , Spikesley , Wheldon and Smith drove a wedge in the Scots defence and England scored early .
I bought a nice wedge yesterday .

Filings of biscuity paper wedge under my fingernails causing me real pain .

Slices , wedges or twists of peel add both flavour and colour to garnishes , and the juice adds zing to drinks , soufflés and sorbets .
